intro: Porophyllum linifolium, commonly known as the slenderleaf horseweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, giving it its common name, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Porophyllum linifolium is often found in arid regions and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient environments.
